gov_controls_v1.status: AuthorityIllusionPenalty + EpistemicMemoryMetadata PROMOTED; RoleDrift + BehavioralEnvelope remain STAGED; SemanticRegression excluded.

LOC.role: LLM acts as judgment provider, not decision-maker.

MOCD.identity: MetaBlooms OS is a governance/control system; LLM outputs are advisory.

payload.next_move: Observe staged signals (RoleDrift, BehavioralEnvelope) during normal use; re-run probe sweep later to calibrate thresholds before any enforcement.

run_commands.mb:contract: Print MOCD + LOC (operator rules) for any LLM/operator
run_commands.mb:gov: Show promoted/staged governance controls + signals + scoring impacts
run_commands.mb:os-audit: Audit project pack integrity + missing pieces

payload.what_this_is: Project-files pointer pack (tiny on purpose). Contains boot rules + governance contracts + promoted/staged governance controls. Real payload lives in referenced bundles already in Project Files.

links.purpose: Mobile filename frontload contract (Android Project Files UI)

integration_points.add: Project Files Naming Contract section + slot prefixes as canonical names
One-line rule: 'Mobile UI truncates filenames; trust slot prefixes MB__00/01/03/90.'

impact: breaks 'cavemen with power tools' usability constraint
adds hesitation friction during routine ops
problem.symptom: Android Project Files list truncates filenames, making multiple .mips.json files indistinguishable at a glance.

provenance.source: User observed mobile UI truncation ambiguity; prior chat solution not captured into Delta.

contract: All Project Files MUST have first 24 characters unique and semantic.
Filenames MUST start with a stable slot prefix: MB__00, MB__01, MB__03, MB__90, etc.
Meaning must be front-loaded (do not rely on suffix timestamps).
Sentinel remains source of truth; filenames exist to reduce mobile friction.

recommended_slots.meaning: Active State / Sentinel (source of truth pointer)

payload.title: Mobile Filename Frontload Contract (Android Project Files UI)

checks: In Android Project Files list view, each file is uniquely identifiable from the left/truncated portion.
User can tell CorePack vs External Intel without opening files.
validation.rollback: Revert filenames; no content changes required.

best_unique_contribution_by_llm.biggest_value: Explicit 'never run arbitrary JS' + treat Action Runner as a whitelisted interpreter; cryptographically chained receipts; replay engine as trust primitive.
Framed as 'Intelligence Harness' with Governance Spine as single point of truth; emphasized policy-driven control plane first.
Concrete Electron implementation hooks (webContents/BrowserView, capturePage, debugger/CDP) and pragmatic phased deliverables.
Maintainability doctrine: reject weekly patching; commit to API-first + diff/apply flows; high-signal Phase 0 milestone definition.
Hard/soft blocker distinction and candid realism about illusion vs production; prompted 'FrictionHunter' concept for finding real-world breakages.

ranking_worst_to_best.name: Generic feasibility table (without shell ownership clarification)
ranking_worst_to_best.why_worst: Assumed Chrome-extension limits; underestimates what owning the webview enables.

ranking_worst_to_best.name: Early Grok feasibility (pre-clarification)
ranking_worst_to_best.why: Over-emphasized 'illusion' and ToS blockers before the shell framing.

ranking_worst_to_best.name: Claude architecture writeup
ranking_worst_to_best.why: Strong practicality, but still too optimistic about DOM editing for complex SaaS (Docs) without making API-only path non-negotiable.

ranking_worst_to_best.name: Gemini Intelligence Harness
ranking_worst_to_best.why: Best control-plane clarity; less concrete on implementation wiring.

ranking_worst_to_best.name: DeepSeek/Copilot clean-room interpreter plan
ranking_worst_to_best.why: Security posture is strongest; replay + signed logs are differentiators.

ranking_worst_to_best.name: MetaBlooms Blueprint v2 (current)
ranking_worst_to_best.why_best: Combines governance contract, isolation model, API-first strategy, rot thresholds, and explicit kill criteria aligned with your constraints.

acceptance_tests: Replay reproduces final-state hash on fixtures
No execution IPC path exists from renderer
top_changes.title: Phase 0 must be 'Action/Governance Contract' not 'Webview capabilities'
top_changes.what: Implement ActionPlan schema + PROPOSE→PREVIEW→APPROVE→EXECUTE→RECEIPT state machine + chained receipts + deterministic replay on fixtures before touching real sites/APIs.
top_changes.why_it_matters: Everything else (perception, APIs, automation) becomes safer, testable, and composable; prevents 'silent autonomy' regression.

acceptance_tests: All Google actions are API calls or user-mediated apply
top_changes.title: Use API-first for Google Workspace; 'typing feel' = diff/patch UX
top_changes.what: Explicitly forbid DOM automation for Docs/Sheets as primary path; implement API-based diffs + user-mediated apply/patch for unsupported edits.
top_changes.why_it_matters: Avoids ToS traps + weekly patching; maintains trust and sustainability.

acceptance_tests: Action runner accepts only validated action types
Governance rejects any plan containing raw JS payloads
top_changes.title: Privilege isolation: camera-like perception + write-only action runner
top_changes.what: Separate Perception (read-only, sanitized) from Action Runner (whitelisted interpreter); never execute arbitrary JS from model output.
top_changes.why_it_matters: Stops prompt-injection and 'AI writes JS → run it' compromise class.

acceptance_tests: Fallbacks exist (ask user / API / apply patch)
top_changes.title: Selector-rot policy: blessed origins + accessibility anchors + rot telemetry
top_changes.what: DOM-first actions only on a small whitelist; target elements via accessibility roles/names, not brittle CSS; log rot incidents and enforce a weekly rot threshold.
top_changes.why_it_matters: Meets 'no weekly patching' constraint by design.

acceptance_tests: In mobile list, each file is distinguishable
Sentinel names the exact 3–5 active files
top_changes.title: Mobile file discoverability: frontloaded filenames + sentinel+index canonical map
top_changes.what: Project files must be identifiable from the first ~15–20 chars; keep a sentinel + index as the source of truth.
top_changes.why_it_matters: Fixes the mobile friction where file list truncation hides meaning.

payload.why: Capture the net-new, high-leverage system lessons from multi-LLM plan comparison; lock the correct build order and guardrails; reduce mobile project-file ambiguity.

payload.goal: Own the browsing environment (chat + controlled web view) with governed propose→approve execution and auditable memory/replay.
key_decisions: Shell choice: Electron (Chromium bundled) vs Tauri (WebView2 on Windows) vs CEF (heavier, complex) — decide via Phase-0 spikes.
API-first for Google surfaces; DOM-write only in controlled/test pages; avoid weekly selector patching.
payload.name: ChatGPT-native browser — feasibility + build order

notes.google_safety_rule: Prefer Workspace APIs; where Docs API is insufficient, use diff + user-apply rather than DOM hacking.
notes.maintainability_rule: If a feature requires selector tuning weekly, reject it; move to API-first or user-mediated apply.

phase0_spikes: Spike A (stack): Build hello-world shell with split panes + webview + IPC + secure preload; measure RAM/CPU on your machine.
Spike B (perception): Extract a compact perception frame (title/url/selected element/a11y roles/text summary) and keep it under a fixed byte cap.
Spike C (governance loop): Emit ActionPlan JSON → render preview → approve → execute noop → write ActionReceipt to append-only log; verify replay.
payload.prompt_to_run_elsewhere:
MISSION: Evaluate feasibility + difficulty + best build order for a “ChatGPT-native browser” (custom browser shell I control, not a Chrome hack).

ROLE: You are a systems architect + security engineer + product maintainer. Be blunt. No hype.

CORE IDEA (what I’m building):
A custom browser shell that hosts:
1) a ChatGPT-style chat UI, and
2) a controlled web view (embedded browser)
so the assistant can:
- perceive pages via DOM/semantic extraction,
- propose actions as structured plans,
- preview them,
- require explicit user approval,
- execute via a permissioned action runner,
- and write an append-only receipt log + replayable audit trail.

NON-NEGOTIABLE CONSTRAINTS:
- No silent autonomy: PROPOSE → PREVIEW → USER APPROVE → EXECUTE → RECEIPT LOG.
- Strong governance: enforce MOCD/LOC; role-drift detection; authority-illusion penalties (block/penalize “I already did X”).
- Memory is externalized + auditable (append-only), with provenance + TTL/decay for semantic memories.
- “Feels like typing in Google Docs/Sheets” WITHOUT ToS-violating hacks:
  - Prefer official Google Workspace APIs with OAuth + diff/preview.
  - If an API can’t do it (e.g., rich Docs editing), require user-mediated apply (copy/paste or “apply patch” UX) instead of brittle DOM automation.
- Maintainability is king: reject features that require weekly patching (selector whack-a-mole). Prefer API-first + accessibility roles/labels + limited blessed surfaces.

DELIVERABLES (be concrete, not generic):
1) Architecture blueprint: subsystems + data flow
   - Chat Surface
   - Controlled Web View
   - Perception Layer
   - Action Runner
   - Governance Spine
   - Memory + Replay (append-only)
   Include what runs in main vs renderer (or equivalent) and how you isolate privileges.

2) Capability feasibility table (custom shell, not an extension)
   For each capability, rate:
   - Feasibility (High/Med/Low)
   - Difficulty (1–10)
   - Rot risk (Low/Med/High)
   - Notes on “API-first vs DOM-first”

3) Phased roadmap (0→4) with decision gates
   - Phase 0 must be the single highest-leverage milestone.
   - Each phase needs: deliverables, success criteria, hard blockers, soft blockers, and the “kill criteria” (when to stop).

4) “What not to do” list
   - Trust bombs (ways to destroy user trust)
   - Permission fatigue traps
   - ToS traps (especially for Google)
   - Maintainability anti-patterns

5) Single highest-leverage Phase 0 milestone
   Must be specific (e.g., “ActionPlan schema + audit log + preview UI working on a synthetic page”), not vague.

BOUNDARIES:
- Assume Windows 10 + older hardware; prefer architectures that don’t require heavy, fragile build chains unless justified.
- Do NOT propose illegal/ToS-violating automation.
- If you claim something is a hard blocker, explain exactly why and what the closest safe approximation is.

OUTPUT FORMAT:
- Use headings matching the 5 deliverables.
- Be brutally explicit about tradeoffs (Electron vs Tauri/WebView2 vs CEF).
- End with: “Recommended build order” (bullet list) + “Top 5 risks” (ranked) + “First 3 spike experiments” (paste-ready).
recommended_order: Phase 0: Lock ActionPlan schema + governance gate + append-only audit log + preview UI (on synthetic test page).
Phase 1: Read-only perception frames from real sites + chat Q&A + planning; still no execution.
Phase 2: Low-risk execution on controlled pages + generic sites using accessibility roles/labels; receipts + rollback-by-design where possible.
Phase 3: Google Sheets API (and limited Docs API) integration using OAuth + diff/preview/apply; no DOM-typing for Docs/Sheets.
Phase 4: Hardening: role-drift detection, incident dashboards, adapter library for blessed surfaces.

payload.notes: This file captures the user-authored consolidated blueprint/spec for the ChatGPT-native browser shell. It is intended to be stored in Project Files to prevent cross-chat loss.
payload.spec_markdown:
1) Architecture blueprint

Overview
A minimal, governable browser shell with a strict state machine: PROPOSE → PREVIEW → USER APPROVE → EXECUTE → RECEIPT LOG. Privileges are isolated. All memory is externalized and append-only with provenance and TTL/decay.

---

Subsystems and data flow

- Chat surface:  
  - Role: Conversational UI for proposing and reviewing actions.  
  - Data flow:  
    - Inbound: Perception summaries, prior receipts, OAuth scopes available, page context.  
    - Outbound: Structured ActionPlans, user approvals, governance signals (role assertions, authority claims).  
  - Isolation: Runs in a renderer with no direct OS/network access; communicates via IPC to the Governance Spine.

- Controlled web view:  
  - Role: Embedded browser used only for perception, previews, and executing approved actions.  
  - Data flow:  
    - Inbound: Navigation commands, content capture requests, action execution scripts (approved), sandbox policy.  
    - Outbound: DOM snapshots, accessibility tree extracts, CDP events, action execution receipts.  
  - Isolation: Separate renderer/process. No Node/OS APIs. Network requests pass through Main for policy checks.

- Perception layer:  
  - Role: Extract semantic page data safely to minimize selector rot.  
  - Data flow:  
    - Inbound: CDP/DevTools Protocol hooks, accessibility tree, computed styles, landmarks, microdata/schema.org when present.  
    - Outbound: Normalized PageContext: roles, headings, forms, buttons with stable descriptors; content hashes; safety flags.  
  - Isolation: Worker in the WebView renderer. Only returns summaries, not arbitrary exfiltration.

- Action runner:  
  - Role: Execute approved plans either via official APIs or controlled scripts.  
  - Data flow:  
    - Inbound: Approved ActionPlan with scoped permissions, OAuth tokens, patch payloads, execution budget.  
    - Outbound: Execution results, diffs, receipts, error codes (including authority-illusion violations).  
  - Isolation: Lives in Main. Invokes:  
    - API-first integrations (Google Workspace, etc.).  
    - For DOM-first: limited, accessibility-anchored interactions with strict origin whitelist.  
    - All outputs go through Governance Spine to log receipts.

- Governance spine:  
  - Role: Enforce the state machine, detect role drift, and block “authority illusion.”  
  - Data flow:  
    - Inbound: All IPC messages, proposed actions, perceived context, execution events.  
    - Outbound: Approval gates, deny reasons, penalties, audit-chain updates.  
  - Isolation: Main-only. Holds policy registry, scope manager, and receipt chain builder.  
  - Mechanics:  
    - Enforce MOCD/LOC-like constraints: only certain roles can propose vs execute; model claims are linted.  
    - “I already did X” claims are blocked unless a matching receipt exists.  
    - Strict origin and capability whitelist; rot gates on unsupported surfaces.

- Memory + replay (append-only):  
  - Role: Externalized, immutable event ledger with provenance, plus decaying semantic memory.  
  - Data flow:  
    - Inbound: Perception summaries, ActionPlans, approvals, execution receipts, diffs.  
    - Outbound: Replay timeline, proof-of-execution, state reconstructions.  
  - Isolation: Main-only file-backed store (e.g., SQLite with WAL + content-addressed blobs or flat append-only JSONL with merkle hash chain).  
  - Governance:  
    - Each entry: {id, prevHash, timestamp, actor, origin, planHash, previewHash, approvalHash, executeResultHash}.  
    - Semantic memory TTL: decays weights over time; never deletes ledger entries.  
    - Redaction via tombstone overlays (never destructive).

---

Process and privilege isolation

- Main process:  
  - Responsibilities: Governance Spine, Action Runner, OAuth/keyring, receipt ledger, network policy, auto-update, origin whitelist.  
  - Privileges: OS filesystem, keyring, network with policy.  
  - IPC: Strict schemas; only Governance can authorize execution.

- Renderer: Chat surface:  
  - Responsibilities: UI, conversation, previews.  
  - Privileges: No Node; contextIsolation true; custom protocol disabled.  
  - IPC: Request-only; cannot execute without Governance approval.

- Renderer: Controlled Web View:  
  - Responsibilities: Perception and executing approved, scoped actions via CDP.  
  - Privileges: No Node; strict Content-Security-Policy.  
  - IPC: Perception outputs; action completion events; cannot call OS APIs.

---

Framework tradeoffs (Windows 10, older hardware)

- Electron (Chromium + Node):  
  - Pros: Mature, full CDP access, faster dev velocity, broad ecosystem, stable on Win10.  
  - Cons: Heavier footprint; must harden (disable Node in renderer, strict IPC).  
  - Verdict: Best for speed and CDP control. Accept the size; gain maintainability via well-known practices.

- Tauri (Rust + WebView2):  
  - Pros: Small footprint, Rust safety, uses Edge’s WebView2.  
  - Cons: WebView2 CDP access exists but is more limited; fewer deep hooks; extra Rust toolchain overhead on Win10.  
  - Verdict: Viable if footprint is top priority; harder to implement fine-grained perception/execution.

- CEF (Chromium Embedded Framework):  
  - Pros: Maximum control, direct CDP, can harden deeply.  
  - Cons: Heavy build chain, maintenance burden, frequent Chromium updates needed.  
  - Verdict: Overkill for v1; choose only if you need long-term control and are ready for ongoing maintenance.

---

2) Capability feasibility table

| Capability | Feasibility | Difficulty (1–10) | Rot risk | Notes: API-first vs DOM-first |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| DOM perception via accessibility tree + landmarks | High | 4 | Low | Use CDP Accessibility domains; prefer roles/labels over selectors. |
| Semantic extraction (forms, buttons, headings, schema.org) | High | 5 | Med | Heuristics + microdata; avoid site-specific rules where possible. |
| Structured ActionPlan schema + preview diffs | High | 3 | Low | Core internal; stable; drives governance and UX. |
| Strict state machine (PROPOSE → PREVIEW → APPROVE → EXECUTE → RECEIPT) | High | 3 | Low | Internal policy; enforce via Governance Spine. |
| Authority-illusion detection (“I already did X” without receipts) | High | 4 | Low | Receipt-chain matching; block/penalize outputs. |
| Append-only receipt log with replay | High | 5 | Low | Content-addressed entries; chain hashing; WAL-backed store. |
| Google Docs read + diff preview via API | High | 6 | Low | Docs API for content retrieval; compute diff; show patch. API-first only. |
| Google Docs structured edits via API | Medium | 7 | Low | BatchUpdate requests; limited rich tooling; keep to supported ops. |
| “Feels like typing” in Docs without DOM hacks | Low | 8 | High | Hard blocker: ToS and technical limits. Closest safe: API patch + user-mediated apply. |
| Google Sheets read/write via API | High | 5 | Low | Sheets API stable; diff preview feasible. |
| OAuth scopes management + consent UX | High | 4 | Low | Use limited scopes; rotate tokens securely; keychain storage. |
| Controlled navigation and form filling on generic sites | Medium | 6 | High | DOM-first with accessibility anchors and strict whitelist; expect rot. |
| CDP-based action execution (click, type) on whitelisted origins | Medium | 6 | Med | Keep to a small blessed set; add rot monitoring and fallbacks. |
| Network policy + origin whitelist | High | 4 | Low | Centralized in Main; gate actions by origin. |
| Role-drift detection (assistant proposing vs executing) | High | 4 | Low | Validate actor/role tags in outputs; block wrong role actions. |
| Preview before execution (DOM patch simulation) | Medium | 6 | Med | Safe on API-first; for DOM-first show simulated outcomes, not live changes. |
| Replayable audit trail with deterministic steps | Medium | 7 | Med | DOM state can vary; deterministic on API-first; snapshot inputs for DOM. |
| User-mediated “apply patch” UX (clipboard/click-to-apply) | High | 3 | Low | Reliable; avoids ToS traps; clear governance. |
| Accessibility role-based targeting | High | 5 | Med | Encouraged; less rot than selectors; still site-dependent. |

---

3) Phased roadmap (0→4) with decision gates

Phase 0: Governance + ActionPlan + audit core
...
(Full text preserved in spec.)
payload.title: ChatGPT-Native Browser — Blueprint v2 (User-authored, normalized)

Embedded_Artifacts.payload:
MB FILE-FIRST DEFAULT — PROJECT/OS ARTIFACT RULE
================================================

RULE (P0):
Whenever any output belongs in the OS or Project Files (spec, delta, roadmap, policy, contract, checklist, schema, validator rules, governance rules, or any system-level decision), the assistant MUST create a downloadable file artifact as part of the same response.

DEFAULT BEHAVIOR:
1) Create the file first (no “concept-only” drops).
2) Provide a direct download link.
3) Then provide a short human summary.

QUALITY BAR:
- Use correct naming conventions (MB__NN__...).
- Wrap artifacts in MIPS format when applicable.
- Treat missing-file delivery as a bug requiring immediate correction.

SCOPE:
Applies to all MetaBlooms workstreams, including Sandcrawler, governance, deltas, specs, build packs, HTML lessons, scripts, and reports.

CREATED (UTC): 2025-12-13T23:51:31Z

payload.author: MetaBlooms

boot_contract.invariant: Exactly one OS_CORE file may exist

delta_registry.integration_rule: No DELTA is active unless registered here

payload.description: Single authoritative MetaBlooms OS core. All DELTAs, CorePacks, and Rules must explicitly target this file.

authority_illusion_rules.enforcement: Block output unless matching receipt exists

os_directives.file_first_rule: If it matters, it must be downloadable
os_directives.no_ghost_state: State not present in files does not exist

benchmark_5_features: Epistemic controls (authority detection, confidence tracking / provenance)
Production validation (>=6 months continuous real use)

evidence_log_v2_row.failure_signal: Self-modification in production and 6+mo continuous runtime remain unverified for major gov suites.

metaBlooms_positioning_factful: Differentiator: conversation-native governance + delta-evolution discipline (where evidenced internally).
Competitive landscape: strong runtime safety programs exist; self-modifying governance remains rare/opaque publicly.
meta_conclusion.reason: Public evidence supports runtime governance + procurement/deployment signals; self-modifying delta-evolution loops are not evidenced in these public deployments, and >=6mo continuous runtime is mostly unproven for 2025 launches.
recommended_os_updates: Add ProductionProof_2of4 gate to ExternalCompetitiveIntel intake; ban 'production' label without links.
Add Watchlist lane for 'ghost posts' (single-source claims) with automatic decay + recheck cadence.
Add FrictionHunter module (stage): collect GitHub issue threads + X replies for each candidate; mark VERIFIED only with 2+ independent signals.

production_proof_rule.name: ProductionProof_2of4
production_proof_rule.threshold: >=2 criteria to label PRODUCTION; else label DEPLOYMENT_SIGNAL or NOT_PRODUCTION

payload.source: User-provided Grok sweep (retagged) + assistant web verification

assumed_until_links: user-friction threads on X/GitHub specific to Claude Gov deployments
systems.name: Claude for Government (Anthropic) — procurement + ASL-3
systems.notes: Public evidence supports safety posture + procurement/contracting; continuous runtime and friction signals not proven publicly.

verified_anchors.claim: DoD awards up to $200M contracts to Anthropic/Google/OpenAI/xAI (Jul 14, 2025)
Official OpenAI for Government announcement (Jun 16, 2025) includes DoD $200M ceiling contract
DoD contract listing for OpenAI Public Sector LLC (Jun 16, 2025)

assumed_until_links: GitHub latency issues tied to specific gov cloud repos/issues
systems.name: Gemini for Government (Google) — Pentagon GenAI.mil deployment signal
systems.notes: Deployment report strengthens workflow integration evidence; still does not prove >=6mo continuous.

verified_anchors.claim: Axios reports wide-scale Pentagon deployment via GenAI.mil (Dec 9, 2025)
GSA press release: xAI partnership + $0.42 per agency for 18 months (Sep 25, 2025)

systems.name: FINOS AI Governance Framework (AIGF)
systems.notes: Treat as SpecAlly comparator; not a turnkey runtime OS/agent control plane.

verified_anchors.claim: FINOS AIGF site (shows v2 release and documentation)

watchlist.policy: Do not treat as production; require repo/demo + non-founder usage signals before promotion.

benchmark_5_features: Epistemic controls (authority detection, confidence tracking / provenance)
Production validation (>=6 months continuous real use)

evidence_log_v2_row.failure_signal: Production>=6mo + self-modification not verifiable from public evidence for major gov suites.

findings.notes: Confirms availability/procurement channel; does not itself prove 6+ months continuous use.
findings.system: GSA MAS adds Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT

findings.notes: ASL-3 described as deployment + security standards targeting CBRN misuse.
Contract awards are strong deployment intent signals; still not direct proof of >=6 months continuous real use.
findings.system: DoD awards up to $200M contracts to Anthropic/Google/OpenAI/xAI (July 14, 2025)

findings.notes: Initiative exists; public docs are high-level on enforcement details.
Framework/spec with ongoing meetings and v2 release; governance blueprint more than turnkey runtime control plane.

meta_conclusion.reason: Publicly verifiable offerings emphasize runtime governance and procurement; self-modifying/delta-mining governance is not evidenced in these deployments, and the >=6mo production criterion is not clearly met for most 2025 launches.
recommended_internal_delta: Add ExternalEvidenceSweep intake type with strict VERIFIED/ASSUMED tagging and a ProductionProof checklist (2-of-4 rule).
Promote Governance Enforcement v0 as P0 roadmap item: passive controls -> active lint/denylist before output.

payload.scope: External competitive intelligence validation of Grok Sandcrawler results: government AI offerings + FINOS AIGF; check for 5-feature benchmark full match.

do: Propose changes as deltas (small, testable, reversible).
Prefer auditability and rollback over cleverness and speed.
Ask for missing inputs only if genuinely blocking; otherwise proceed with best-effort + [ASSUMED] tags.
dont: Assume your output will execute automatically.
Write to long-term memory/state without a gate/promotion step.
Overwrite existing rules or modules; propose append-only deltas.
Claim tool execution you did not perform.
LOC.error_handling: On failure or ambiguity, produce: (1) minimal safe artifact, (2) explicit failure signal, (3) next action that preserves rollback.

interaction_primitives.mb:contract: Print MOCD + LOC for downstream LLMs
interaction_primitives.mb:os-audit: Audit project pack integrity + missing pieces
interaction_primitives.mb:status: Report active pack + promoted/staged + last decisions

LOC.name: LLM Operator Contract (LOC)
LOC.purpose: Prevent category errors and unsafe/incorrect operation by downstream LLMs.

MOCD.name: MetaBlooms Operating Context Declaration (MOCD)
non_negotiables: MetaBlooms is a governance and control system, not an intelligence model.
LLM outputs are advisory; authority is enforced by explicit validation/gating/promotion.
System evolution is delta-based: slice → score → gate → promote → preserve.
Autonomy is bounded and conditional; no implicit execution or ungated memory writes.
MOCD.one_line_canon: MetaBlooms OS governs intelligence; it does not replace it. LLM outputs are advisory and subject to explicit validation, gating, and promotion.

payload.next_move: Run mb:os-audit inside the sandbox (I do it here). Then we mine one more delta-pack (PACKSALL.zip) and feed it through DeltaMiner+Slicer+Gate again.

boot_contract.invariant: Exactly one OS_CORE file may exist

delta_registry.integration_rule: No DELTA is active unless registered here

payload.description: Single authoritative MetaBlooms OS core. All DELTAs, CorePacks, and Rules must explicitly target this file.

authority_illusion_rules.enforcement: Block output unless matching receipt exists

os_directives.file_first_rule: If it matters, it must be downloadable
os_directives.no_ghost_state: State not present in files does not exist

payload.next_move: Run mb:os-audit inside the sandbox (I do it here). Then we mine one more delta-pack (PACKSALL.zip) and feed it through DeltaMiner+Slicer+Gate again.

run_commands.mb:os-audit: Audit /mnt/data project pack integrity + missing pieces
run_commands.mb:status: Print active pack + promoted/staged + last decisions

payload.what_this_is: Project-files pointer pack (tiny on purpose). The real payload lives in the referenced ZIPs/JSON already in project files.

Integrity_Checks.action: This build cannot restore any content that is not present in the current project files or uploaded bundles. If you have an older large OS file, upload it and I will merge it.

MetaBlooms_OS.name: MetaBlooms OS
MetaBlooms_OS.notes: Restored volume by re-integrating all project-file specs/deltas/artifacts present in /mnt/data as of build time.
